intro: Elegia propinquus var. minor, commonly known as the lesser water starwort, is a flowering plant native to wetland environments in North America. It belongs to the family Onagraceae and is characterized by its small, star-shaped flowers that bloom in late spring. The plant typically grows in shallow water or moist soils, often found in marshes and along the edges of ponds. Its leaves are narrow and grass-like, while its stems are slender and often匍匐 (prostrate). It plays a role in aquatic ecosystems by providing habitat for small invertebrates and contributing to water filtration.
